page.title: 01South coastline - L Gairloch
page.content: Landscape: rocky coastline, islands, undulating moorland,hamlet of Badachro. people: some work locally in fishing and in the Inn. Many rely on the seasonal tourist trade, letting caravans, houses, boats and going bed an breakfast. Others work away, wherever work can be found. The community relies heavily on Gairloch:there is only one local shop/post office. the mobile bank calls fortnightly. There is a small amount of peat cutting for fuel. Sheep roam the moor, which is owned by conon Estate, Inverness. there are many pleasure boats, private yachts in the sheltered bay. The jetting is a focal point for visitors. Boats are for hire. The schools and shops are in gairloch 7 miles away. Further education is even further!
